Really close to downtown. Night can be a little dangerous (if you aren't smart about what you're doing). On the other hand, police presence is great and most people look out for both themselves and others.
Lots of options. Some of the frats definitely haze (people have gotten hurt). Greek life's not for me (can't stand some of the people), but if it's your thing, this is the place to go.

There are over 100 student orgs on campus. Multiple clubs meet on a daily basis. You can always find people playing frisbee, football, baseball, and other sports. The university sponsors multiple activities. Usually dorms have special activities. There are plenty of volunteer opportunities. Finally, of couse, the parties are world-class.
Open-minded Adventuresome Out-going Curious Academically-minded The list goes on. Check it out.

Some traditions: PRT cram, football games, diversity week, couch burning (considering the $1000 fine, this isn't a good idea), etc. Great locations: stadium, coliseum, woodburn circle, free-speech area, etc.
In-state tuition is outrageously cheap. Can't beat the price. Financial aid from the state and university covers my tuition and some.
Food, friends, sports, shopping, outdoor leisure, parties, volunteering, and campus organizations are just a few of the options you'll have in Morgantown.
Universities dining halls aren't amazing, but then no one's are usually. Great little cafe's and such all around campus. If you go downtown, there's some awesome local dining.
Haven't lived in a dorm yet, but I hear it's fairly acceptable in terms of normal dorm life.
From experience, I can attest to the fact that engineering courses are difficult (but rewarding). Some of the electives are a little too watered down, but they're still a blast.
Take a trip down and check out the campus and surrounding area. You'll fall in love with it immediately.
WVU exemplifies a great atmosphere. Its diverse culture gives you a sense of adventure and acceptance. Academic culture thrives here among other, similarly important aspects of life.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Kayla from Clarksburg, WV 10/14/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 14 out of 14 people found this review useful. 3 of 163 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Wow, with a campus like WVU it is great for any type of student. Seriously, any stereotype, any click from the athlete to the nerd, from the music major to the chemistry loving geek, from country to hard rock, white, black and every color in between you will fit in at WVU. The diversity here is amazing. I frequently spend my lunch just people watching and enjoying all the variety WVU has to offer. I myself have been challenged to look beyond who I am and reinvent who I will become. At am a musician, playing in the orchestra, a nerd in the honors program, an athlete running and attending spinning classes daily, a teacher working with students at a local school, a mentor for teenagers at the rec center, a room mate and friend to several girls from all over the country. WVU is great for all
